item.title: Pokemon GO: Can Tadbulb Be Shiny
item.description:
Pokemon GO features Tadbulb in multiple events such as Instrumental Wonders 2025. Events feature numerous ways to get Tadbulb but you can also get it as a wild spawn on normal days. Many players wonder if they can get a Shiny Tadbulb.

Tadbulb is an Electric-type Pokemon with a maximum Combat Power of 1030 CP. Evolving the monster into a Bellibolt increases its maximum CP and stat spread values. Events featuring Tadbulb increase the monster’s wild spawn rate notably, making it easier to encounter while exploring the map. While Tadbulb availability is common knowledge, many wonder if they can get a Shiny Tadbulb in Pokemon GO . This guide details Shiny Tadbulb’s availability, how to get Shiny Tadbulb if it is available, and more.

Pokemon GO: Is Shiny Tadbulb Available

No , as of now, you cannot get a Shiny Tadbulb in Pokemon GO . While Tadbulb debuted during the Festival of Lights 2023 event, the developers at Niantic relayed no info on Shiny Tadbulb’s in-game debut. It has already been two years since its Standard variant’s release; Shiny Tadbulb might debut in future events focused on lights.

Pokemon GO: How To Get Tadbulb

Tadbulb is a wild Pokemon that is often featured in events increasing its spawn rate. You can use different Pokemon GO items during such events to further boost Tadbulb’s wild spawn rate. The basic strategy is to use Incense, Lure Module, and Weather Boost effect during events featuring Tadbulb.

  • Tadbulb’s Weather Boost takes effect in areas with rainy weather
  • You must find a PokeStop in rainy weather
  • Attach a Lure Module to that PokeStop
  • Activate an Incense and walk around the Lure Module’s visible effect area

While this strategy can increase the wild Tadbulb spawn rate during Pokemon GO events featuring Tadbulb, other wild Pokemon with the same Weather Boost can spawn too.

When Shiny Tadbulb debuts, you can get it by using the same strategy.

Pokemon GO: How To Get Bellibolt

Once you catch a Tadbulb in Pokemon GO , you can evolve it into a Bellibolt. The cost of evolution is 50 Tadbulb Candies which you can collect by catching/transferring numerous Tadbulb. When Shiny Tadbulb debuts, you can evolve it into a Shiny Bellibolt.

Your comment has not been saved

item.title: Mario Kart World Beat Diablo 4 to One Ridiculous Punch
item.description:
Mario Kart World 's fresh open-world take on the iconic kart racing series has already made the game a hit among Nintendo Switch 2 players. While the game offers players a ton of content to uncover, one new Mario Kart World character has quickly jumped to the top of the roster's fan favorites—so much so that Cow players are dominating online lobbies. While it's not all that surprising that this ridiculous new racer has made a name for itself among Mario Kart fans, the lengths that players are going to in order to play as this character have created what is essentially Mario Kart World 's all-cow races.

On the surface, it seems silly to compare the bright, colorful tracks of Mario Kart World to the dark, demon-infested world of Diablo 4 . However, the two communities appear to share one similarity in their obsession with cows. While Mario Kart World players get to have their heyday racing as the Cow, Diablo 4 players continue to struggle with the search for the long-rumored secret cow level many believe to be hidden as an Easter egg within Blizzard's ARPG.

Mario Kart World's Cow-Filled Lobbies Are a Painful Reminder of Diablo 4's Ongoing Cow Level Hunt

The Secret Cow Level is an Inside Joke Among Diablo 4 Fans

Diablo 's secret cow level extends back to Diablo 2 , where completing a series of specific tasks would allow players to access a bonus level filled with cow-like enemies trying to attack them. The cow level returned in Diablo 3 in a slightly different form, known as Whimsyshire, a cartoony area filled with cutesy creatures also out to kill the player. However, in Diablo 4 , the mystery of the secret cow level is still unraveling and lacks a definitive answer like its previous incarnations.

So far, the hunt for Diablo 4 's secret cow level includes the need to kill 666 cows in 666,666 seconds to receive a special relic, but this must be done across three different regions for three different relics. Collecting these relics and accessing the Forlorn Hovel gives players a nice Easter egg referencing past Diablo cow levels, as this area is filled with regular bovine residents. The trail for Diablo 4 's secret cow level goes cold in the Vessel of Hatred expansion, where players can obtain the new Nahantu relic, which leads to the unusual key, and enter the Forlorn Burrow with more cows inside, but nothing more has been found about accessing a true secret cow level at this point.

It's possible that more evidence of Diablo 4 's secret cow level will appear in the next major expansion, slated to release sometime in 2026.

Mario Kart World Makes Its Own Cow Level a Reality with a Popular New Character

While Diablo 4 players are stuck putting together the pieces of a puzzle that may ultimately not exist, Mario Kart World players have been able to enjoy plenty of cow-themed shenanigans thanks to its roster's new star. Mario Kart World 's roster has received a big upgrade over past entries with the addition of a wide variety of playable characters from franchise staples all the way to generic Mario enemies and NPCs. One character that has skyrocketed in popularity among Mario Kart World players is the Cow.

Mario Kart World 's Cow has become so popular that online lobbies have turned into their own "secret cow level" with races becoming filled with players playing as the character. With Mario Kart World supporting online races with up to 24 players, in theory, tracks could become overrun with 24 Cows all competing for first place, and racing on a track like Moo Moo Meadows would add even more cows into the mix. While there's no shortage of bovine fun to be had in Mario Kart World , Diablo 4 players are still stuck scratching their heads trying to access the fabled secret cow level themselves.

Attach a Joy-Con 2 controller to the optional Joy-Con 2 wheel accessory to wheely feel like you're driving. You can also play using Nintendo Switch Joy-Con controllers connected wirelessly.

item.title: Best Difficult Games That Are Easy To Learn
item.description:
Summary

  • Spelunky 2 offers accessibility with lethal hazards in a brutal roguelike structure, delivering a biting edge.
  • Darkest Dungeon 2 provides easy learning with tough combat, a clear user interface, and escalating difficulty.
  • Post Void has simple controls, a breakneck pace, and draining health points, offering easy learning despite high difficulty.

There are many games out there that offer immediate and all-encompassing difficulty, often providing experiences that are wholly inaccessible to newcomers. The most complex of these games are often the most difficult to start, packed with complex systems and unforgiving mechanics that punish even the earliest of mistakes.

However, there remains a number of difficult games that, despite their numerous challenges, are easy to learn. These are titles like Spelunky 2 , with its intuitive control scheme, or Post Void , with its streamlined FPS gameplay.

8 Spelunky 2

An Accessible Platformer With Lethal Hazards

Spelunky 2
9 /10
7.0 /10
Released
September 15, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Fantasy Violence, Blood, Mild Suggestive Themes
Developer(s)
Mossmouth, BlitWorks
Platform(s)
Switch, PS4, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, PC
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

Spelunky 2 is a remarkably approachable 2D platformer with a brutal roguelike structure. In the game, players delve into dangerous caverns packed with lethal hazards and hostile creatures. This sheer abundance of dangers and their often deadly nature gives Spelunky 2 a biting edge.

However, Spelunky 2 remains easy to learn thanks to intuitive controls and a simple gameplay loop, offering clear mechanics that are easy to grasp. As a result, while Spelunky 2 is quick to punish mistakes, it's easy to jump straight back into another run.

7 Darkest Dungeon 2

Intelligible But Unforgiving Turn-Based Combat

Darkest Dungeon 2
Roguelike
RPG
Systems
Released
May 8, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
t
Developer(s)
Red Hook Studios
Platform(s)
PC
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

Darkest Dungeon 2 will be an immediately challenging experience for many players. With its lengthy road-trips across a burning country, this strategy game excels with its tough combat encounters and immersive atmosphere.

Despite its unforgiving gameplay, Darkest Dungeon 2 remains tremendously easy to learn, with a clear and concise user interface. Each run also escalates rather slowly, giving newcomers plenty of time to warm up to the game's systems even within their first run.

6 Post Void

A Simple FPS With A Breakneck Pace

Post Void
10.0 /10
Released
August 6, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
t
Developer(s)
YCJY Games
Platform(s)
PC, PS5, PS4, Switch
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

Offering psychedelic, pixelated visuals and a dizzying soundtrack, Post Void excels with its immediate pace and simple controls. With an expressive but intuitive movement system that takes no time to learn and stripped-back FPS mechanics, Post Void offers a roguelike experience that plays at a breakneck pace.

This pace makes Post Void easier to dive into, but it also provides a great deal of difficulty. In the game, players are subject to constantly draining health points, forced to play at a constant sprint. Since slowing down for even a moment can lead to death, Post Void is a consistently tense and often difficult experience. However, its elegant design ensures it's easy to learn.

5 Sifu

A Simple But Unrelenting Brawler

Sifu
9 /10
9.2 /10
Released
February 8, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood, Drug Reference, Strong Language, Violence
Developer(s)
Sloclap
Platform(s)
Nintendo Switch, PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

Sifu is a stylish and cinematic brawler with an emphasis on martial arts. The game's intuitive controls and accessible combos ensure it's easy to learn, and this allows for an immediate, fast pace. The tutorial is also remarkably stylish, giving players an immersive introduction to the systems, world, and visuals.

Despite the quick and easy learning process, however, Sifu can be hard to master. This is thanks in large part to its fast and snappy combat and the frequency at which players are outnumbered. Furthermore, Sifu features a unique death mechanic that can be quite punishing.

4 Into The Breach

A Turn-Based Tactics Game With Open Information

Into the Breach
Turn-Based Strategy
Systems
Released
February 27, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
e
Platform(s)
Android, iOS, PC, PS4, Nintendo Switch, macOS, Stadia
Powered by

Into The Breach is a surprisingly challenging turn-based tactics game with an emphasis on puzzle-like design. The game's roguelike structure keeps it a relatively punishing experience, but Into The Breach also excels with its player-friendly nature.

Into The Breach is a game of open information, offering detailed enemy telegraphing that ensures players always have the necessary knowledge to make an informed decision. Furthermore, the ability to undo moves and even reset an entire turn ensures players are frequently able to experiment without being punished.

3 Ravenswatch

A Challenging But Intuitive Action Roguelike

Ravenswatch
9.0 /10
Released
September 26, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
N/A
Developer(s)
Passtech Games
Platform(s)
PC
Powered by

Ravenswatch is an intuitive action roguelike with a unique structure, excelling with its diverse playable characters and the addition of cooperative play. With its clear user interface, slower pace, and simple controls, Ravenswatch is immediately easy to grasp, but it can be truly challenging.

Ravenswatch isn't an immediately difficult game, but as players unlock additional game modes, it becomes a more unforgiving experience. Thankfully, the initially forgiving difficulty makes Ravenswatch easy to learn. Furthermore, players don't begin with every upgrade available to them, providing simpler decision-making that quickly opens up into a more expressive system.

2 Wildfrost

A Deceptively Charming Deck-Builder

3 Images
3 Images
Wildfrost
Digital Card Game
Strategy
Roguelike
Systems
Released
April 12, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
E10+ For Everyone 10+ // Fantasy Violence, Mild Blood
Developer(s)
Deadpan Games, Gaziter
Platform(s)
Android, iOS, Nintendo Switch, PC, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

Wildfrost is an immediately charming and easy-to-learn deck builder that excels with its unique but intuitive mechanics. In the game, players battle various enemies on snowy battlefields with a variety of companions, supporting them with strategic card play.

These battlefields are easy to read, and moving companions around during the fight is simple to do and tremendously intuitive. However, Wildfrost can also be extremely punishing, and making even a single mistake can lead to a swift and brutal end.

1 Dark Souls

An Intuitive But Unforgiving ARPG

5 Images
5 Images
Dark Souls
9 /10
13
9.2 /10
Released
September 22, 2011

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Partial Nudity, Violence
Developer(s)
From Software
Platform(s)
PS3, PS4, Xbox 360, Xbox One, Switch, PC
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

Dark Souls is an ARPG with notoriously difficult gameplay. Be it dangerous enemies, challenging boss battles, or the punishing loop, Dark Souls is likely to wear many a player down within a matter of hours. However, its systems are surprisingly easy to learn.

Dark Souls teaches players its core mechanics within a few minutes, effectively introducing them to the game with a simple boss fight. However, while it's easy to learn, the game's difficulty quickly steepens; it's not long before Dark Souls opens up and reveals its unforgiving nature.

item.title: Why Haunted Chocolatier's Possible Distant Release Isn't a Surprise
item.description:
Eric Barone, the solo developer responsible for Stardew Valley , gave an update on Haunted Chocolatier recently that may have left some eager fans disappointed. According to Barone, the highly anticipated Haunted Chocolatier may not be ready until the next decade, meaning Stardew Valley lovers who are awaiting more from the developer may need to gear up for a serious test of patience.

This long wait was confirmed during Barone's recent appearance on comedian Bobby Lee's podcast, TigerBelly. Lee asked Barone if Haunted Chocolatier would come out in the next five years, with Barone simply stating, "I hope so." According to Barone, there is still a lot of work left to do on the game, despite it being announced back in 2021. Although Barone revealed the game nearly four years ago, it's easy to understand why development has been so slow.

Over the Years, Stardew Valley Has Kept Eric Barone Incredibly Busy, Leaving Little Time for Haunted Chocolatier

Barone Has Addressed the Lack of Haunted Chocolatier Updates

Back in December of last year, Barone posted to the official Haunted Chocolatier blog, giving fans insight into why the wait has been so lengthy. In the post, he states, "It’s been a little sad to see Haunted Chocolatier getting dusty on the shelf… but this is the reality of my situation. Stardew Valley is a big and popular game, and I have a lot of attachment to it." One of the biggest reasons as to why progress on Haunted Chocolatier was halted is simply because he was busy working on one of Stardew Valley 's biggest post-launch updates, which was released last year.

He further wrote to fans, "Before I took this break for Stardew 1.6, I had created a 'vertical slice' of Haunted Chocolatier , essentially a skeleton of the game with most (not all) of its bones in place." While having the game's foundation built is a promising hint at Haunted Chocolatier 's current state, it also means there is plenty more work to get done. Beyond the general bones of the game, there are entire mechanics and features that need to be completed. With Barone's history of continuously tweaking Stardew Valley , there's no doubt that he will be meticulous with these decisions.

Naturally, that type of care and attention to detail moves slowly, so when taking that into consideration, it makes a potential 2030 release date for Haunted Chocolatier not surprising at all. It's also important to remember that Barone works alone for the most part, and that's always bound to make game development take even longer.

It’s been a little sad to see Haunted Chocolatier getting dusty on the shelf… but this is the reality of my situation. Stardew Valley is a big and popular game, and I have a lot of attachment to it.

Instead of a farming simulator, Haunted Chocolatier follows a candy maker who also lives inside a castle that happens to be filled with ghosts. Another big difference from Stardew Valley is that Haunted Chocolatier will have a bigger emphasis on combat.

Whenever Haunted Chocolatier Finally Arrives, it Will Be the End of an Era

Over the years, Stardew Valley has been Barone's only work, so Haunted Chocolatier will be the closing of one era, but the beginning of an exciting new one. Stardew Valley 's influence on the indie world has been clear, and when Haunted Chocolatier finally arrives, it will be thrilling to see what the candy-making title has in store, no matter what year it happens to release in.

6 Images

item.title: 7 Open-World Games With The Best Combat, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Red Dead Redemption 2 offers precise and advanced combat with the Dead Eye system.
  • Metal Gear Solid 5 features engaging combat encounters that feel natural and unpredictable.
  • Fallout 4 provides chaotic shooting scenes and utilizes the VATs system for targeting specific enemy parts.

The open-world video game genre has become one of the staples of the industry. These huge, expansive worlds have left players in awe for decades. And within the scope of unlimited possibilities and things to do within these worlds, some of them have also created deep, complex combat systems that allow players to feel powerful in a hostile and aggressive world. These games have found ways to infuse incredible combat into huge worlds, a task that has proven rather difficult over the years due to the unpredictability of the player's involvement.

Some of these games have focused combat encounters around melee and magic, while others see players engaging enemies with firearms and tactical espionage. Whatever route a game takes, these titles have done so with precision, crafting the best combat systems in the open-world genre. These open-world games have been ranked based on their battle systems, and how well the combat encounters are woven into the environments.

7 Red Dead Redemption 2

Use Dead Eye To Eliminate Enemies

Red Dead Redemption 2
10 /10
153
9.5 /10
Released
October 26, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Nudity, Sexual Content, Strong Language, Use of Drugs and Alcohol
Developer(s)
Rockstar Games
Powered by

Rockstar's open-world Wild West epic began in 2003 when they purchased the rights to the Red Dead IP from Capcom, which led to the franchise becoming one of the cornerstones of the company. While the original Red Dead Redemption was an instant classic when it launched in 2010, Rockstar produced a prequel in 2018 that took everything about the first game and improved on it, including the already compelling combat.

Much like the first game, Red Dead Redemption 2 uses the Dead Eye system, which allows the player to lock onto enemies and slow down time in order to mark enemies for execution. Thanks to the improvements in hardware after RDR1 , the prequel features a much more dynamic, free-flowing version of Dead Eye that also utilizes advanced gore to sell the harsh reality of the Old West. Shooting in Red Dead Redemption 2 feels precise and snappy, and is easily Rockstar's most accomplished combat system.

6 Metal Gear Solid 5: The Phantom Pain

The Franchise's Most Complete Combat System

Metal Gear Solid 5 The Phantom Pain
Stealth
Action-Adventure
Shooter
Adventure
Systems
Released
September 1, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL
9 /10

ESRB
m
Developer(s)
Konami, Kojima Productions
Powered by

Metal Gear creator Hideo Kojima continued to expand the combat possibilities of the franchise with Snake Eater and Guns of the Patriots . However, the most refined version of the series' combat system was released in 2015 with The Phantom Pain . Utilizing nearly every aspect of prior combat systems, Kojima and his team crafted a unique, engaging world. Encounters feel natural and are treated with an unpredictability that makes each one more exciting than the last.

After setting the stage with Ground Zeroes , a prologue released a little over a year prior to the launch of The Phantom Pain , the team at Kojima Productions crafted what is still one of the most incredible examples of an open-world stealth game ever made. The Phantom Pain also offers a wide variety of tools and abilities that Snake can use during combat. The act of marking a base for infiltration, then raiding it, is one of the most addictive game feels of the last generation. Guns feel powerful and aggressive, while dismantling enemies with CQC remains one of the most satisfying feelings in the franchise's history.

5 Fallout 4

The Best Version Of The Franchise's Hectic Shooter Gameplay

Fallout 4
9 /10
45
8.8 /10
Released
November 10, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M FOR MATURE: BLOOD AND GORE, INTENSE VIOLENCE, STRONG LANGUAGE, USE OF DRUGS
Developer(s)
Bethesda
Powered by

After shepherding Fallout from its roots as a top-down 2D experience into a 3D first-person RPG, Bethesda continued to improve and challenge the status quo of this iconic franchise. This culminated in the fourth entry, which launched in 2015. With Fallout 4 taking full advantage of next-generation hardware, Bethesda managed to create what is still the best combat in the franchise. Even a decade later, it remains one of the most fun open-world RPGs of all time.

Much like the rest of the series, Fallout 4 uses VATS, the Vault-Tec Assisted Targeting System, which allows players to effectively pause the game and target specific body parts of enemies. It bridges the gap between classic and modern Fallout , allowing the new games to play similarly to the older titles without feeling like too radical of a departure. Fallout 4 features some of the most intense, chaotic shooting scenes in the series. It also recently received a next-gen update for modern consoles, making it even more exciting to jump into today.

4 Elden Ring

FromSoftware's Trademark Combat Blends Seamlessly Into Their First Open World

Elden Ring
10 /10
63
9.1 /10
Released
February 25, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Language, Suggestive Themes, Violence
Developer(s)
From Software
Powered by

After creating some of the most influential, successful video games of all time, FromSoftware decided to take their skill at designing intricate labyrinths and direct that effort into the open-world genre. The end result was Elden Ring , a massive and wonderfully detailed open world. The came captures FromSoftware's uncanny ability to create hand-crafted settings , but never lost a step when it came to combat, a specialty of this talented studio.

The prospect of transitioning FromSoftware's combat style into a large-scale experience was risky, but it worked out wonderfully. Like FromSoftware's other games, Elden Ring relies on detail-oriented combat, where each encounter requires something different. Confrontations with enemies and bosses are built around patience, tasking the player with utilizing every skill at their disposal. The combat system featured in Elden Ring is one of FromSoftware's best, alongside classics like Bloodborne and Sekiro: Shadows Die Twice .

3 The Legend Of Zelda: Breath Of The Wild

The Iconic Franchise Goes Open-World

The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild
10 /10
45
9.2 /10
Released
March 3, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
E for Everyone: Fantasy Violence, Use of Alcohol, Mild Suggestive Themes
Developer(s)
Nintendo EPD
Powered by

After spending decades creating some of the most legendary worlds and locations in video games, The Legend of Zelda franchise was poised to break out, and did so in spectacular fashion with Breath of the Wild . The Zelda series has featured some rather large worlds in the past, but Breath of the Wild was a step above into a fully open world. It also maintained the franchise's commitment to impeccable combat.

Breath of the Wild features fast-paced, entertaining melee combat and outstanding ranged conflict. As Link feels nimble and agile, moving him through the wide open fields of Hyrule is incredible, and engaging with the game's expansive variety of enemies is a delight. In terms of combat, the Zelda franchise has never felt better, as the player has access to a huge list of tools and abilities to overcome the evil that threatens Hyrule. The physics of the world makes it feel alive, like anything is possible.

2 Cyberpunk 2077

Wake Up, Samurai

Cyberpunk 2077
6 /10
73
8.6 /10
Released
December 10, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Nudity, Strong Language, Strong Sexual Content, Use of Drugs and Alcohol
Developer(s)
CD Projekt Red
Powered by

After a rough launch in 2020, developers CD Projekt Red worked to elevate Cyberpunk 2077 to the game it was promised to be. They have done a remarkable job in that quest. One of the areas that was in need of refinement the most was combat, and CDPR was able to transform the game into something special, a far cry from its disappointing launch.

Cyberpunk 2077's kinetic, entertaining combat has evolved and re-shaped itself over the years, emerging as one of the most fun open-world video games on the market. As an RPG, Cyberpunk allows the player to choose what combat avenues they want to explore, offering a fantastic variety of different play styles. Ranging from the Netrunner to the Corpo build, Cyberpunk 207 7 offers a huge, distinct number of possibilities. Shooting and melee feel fabulous, with terrific feedback, as Cyberpunk 2077 remains one of the genre's most spectacular entries.

1 Marvel's Spider-Man

With Great Power, Comes Great Responsibility

Marvel's Spider-Man
9.0 /10
Released
September 7, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
T For Teen Due To Blood, Drug Reference, Language, Mild Suggestive Themes, Violence
Developer(s)
Insomniac Games
Powered by

Having dominated film, television and video games for the past sixty years, Spider-Man has become one of the entertainment industry's most iconic and successful characters. But when it comes to Spidey's turn in video games, no title has ever been able to compete with 2018's Spider-Man. This open-world masterpiece felt like a dream come true for fans of the webhead. The developers at Insomniac knew that one of the most important aspects of a video game based on Spider-Man is the action, and they passed with flying colors. This stellar title features the best combat system in any open-world game on the market today.

Spider-Man uses all the things that make the character so appealing in his other media appearances. Every element of his wall-crawling, web-slinging, and furious punches and kicks work in tandem. The feeling of zipping around an environment, flipping over enemies, and delivering brutal take-downs is still unmatched by any open-world game, as it allows players to live out the power fantasy of being Spider-Man. And when Spidey isn't taking out waves of goons and towering bosses, sneaking around and picking enemies off from above feels magical. Spider-Man captures the spirit and action of the classic Marvel Comics character flawlessly, and is in a class of its own when it comes to open-world combat.
